title: High cpu usage dispite hardware acceleration
content:
I have the issue that despite hardware acceleration is working Firefox causes a high cpu usage which leads to the CPU is constantly boosting to high frequencies and this to higher power consumption. In about:processes of Firefox I can see that the main process is at CPU usage around 150% or higher and tabs (8 in total usually) that contain live stream video spiking up to 50%. nvtop, intel_gpu_top and LACT all indicate that hardware acceleration is working. btop shows even a CPU usage of the Firefox main process over 175%. The overall CPU usage of the system is at 60%. I couldn‚Äôt find any helpful information so far in the internet. Maybe here we can get trace of the cause. The reason is I want to bring down the power consumption. Question is is there an issue or I am facing a (hardware) limitation.

I did two traces with Firefox profiler.

Here and here are the results.

I can provide additional information and logs if needed.
creator: Erik.Schick

title: On Exit Firefox closes all open tabs
content:
As a resent change Firefox closes all my open tabs when I exit. That is not what I want. Not sure if it's an update to version 128.13.0esr(64-bit) that is the reason for this issue.

I History I have the settings: - Remember browsing and download history (activated) - Remember search and form history (activated) - Clear history when Firefox closes (deactivated)

I have activated "Confirm before closing multiple tabs" and when I exit I get a notification that Firefox will close all tabs.

Is this a bug or do I need to change a setting somewhere ?

title: Delete history by days right from history panel
content:
Hello. I have an issue with history panel.

In previous of Firefox the history, split by date, each day's block used to have it's own actions: it had a context menu with "Delete" item. Also it was possible to put focus on some day, press Delete button on keyboard and to get all items of this day removed from the history.

Since version 141 it is not possible.

Please get this opportunity back.
